greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows, n-th row = (n-2)-th row appended to the beginning of (n-1)-th row, + n.
comment: There are (1, 2, 4, 7, 12,...) terms per row where (0, 0, 1, 2, 4, 7, 12,...) = A000071 = Fibonacci numbers - 1.
formula: Triangle read by rows, n-th row = (n-2)-th row appended to the beginning of (n-1)-th row, + n.
example: First few rows of the triangle are:
Row 4 = (1, 2, 1, 1, 2, 3, 4) = (row 2 appended to row 3, + 4); = (1, 2) appended to (1, 1, 2, 3), then 4.
results.author: _Gary W. Adamson_, Jun 22 2008
